20101231161353.000|20101231161356.000|TR0|financial flexibility.
20101231161356.000|20101231161359.000|TR0|
20101231161359.000|20101231161402.000|TR0|More of your discretionary income is 
20101231161402.000|20101231161405.000|TR0|actually yours to use and not to pay off 
20101231161405.000|20101231161408.000|TR0|your debts and to pay off your fixed 
20101231161408.000|20101231161411.000|TR0|expenses.  A little bit more, that is.  
20101231161411.000|20101231161414.000|TR0|And so, that is something that's good news 
20101231161414.000|20101231161417.000|TR0|for American families into next year.
20101231161417.000|20101231161420.000|TR0|
20101231161420.000|20101231161423.000|TR0|(END VIDEOTAPE)

20101231161737.000|20101231161740.000|TR0|so many thousands of laws, it's hard to

20101231161743.000|20101231161746.000|TR0|time there's a new cycle, including the

20101231161752.000|20101231161755.000|TR0|some of them are right here in Illinois.

20101231161810.000|20101231161813.000|TR0|
20101231161813.000|20101231161816.000|TR0|This was actually signed.  The new law was 
20101231161816.000|20101231161819.000|TR0|signed on the anniversary of his arrest.  
20101231161819.000|20101231161822.000|TR0|And it says that individuals are limited 
20101231161822.000|20101231161825.000|TR0|to giving a candidate $5,000 in one 
20101231161825.000|20101231161828.000|TR0|election cycle.  Groups like unions and 
20101231161828.000|20101231161831.000|TR0|political action committees are limited to 
20101231161831.000|20101231161834.000|TR0|$10,000.
20101231161834.000|20101231161836.000|TR0|

20101231161842.000|20101231161845.000|TR0|country.  This one is about vending

20101231161848.000|20101231161851.000|TR0|health care reform legislation that

20101231161918.000|20101231161921.000|TR0|work.  Your flexible spending account,

20101231161930.000|20101231161933.000|TR0|lot of cash that way, not paying taxes on

20101231161938.000|20101231161941.000|TR0|Now, here's another one.  This is

20101231161944.000|20101231161947.000|TR0|
20101231161947.000|20101231161950.000|TR0|In Maryland, if you get pulled over by a 
20101231161950.000|20101231161953.000|TR0|police officer and ticketed, instead of 
20101231161953.000|20101231161956.000|TR0|the officer giving you a trial date, you 
20101231161956.000|20101231161959.000|TR0|can actually later request your own trial 
20101231161959.000|20101231162002.000|TR0|date.  Apparently, a lot of people were 
20101231162002.000|20101231162005.000|TR0|waiting until the day before the trial to 
20101231162005.000|20101231162008.000|TR0|call in and pay their tickets, and that

20101231162716.000|20101231162719.000|TR0|looking for, and it may be a surprise to 
20101231162719.000|20101231162722.000|TR0|many, is that when the Supreme Court tags 
20101231162722.000|20101231162725.000|TR0|takes the case -- and it will -- number

20101231162754.000|20101231162757.000|TR0|be in existence because it is 
20101231162757.000|20101231162800.000|TR0|constitutional.

20101231162806.000|20101231162809.000|TR0|think, a lot of folks who see a different 
20101231162809.000|20101231162812.000|TR0|outcome for that.
20101231162812.000|20101231162815.000|TR0|
20101231162815.000|20101231162818.000|TR0|FRIEDMAN:  I'm sure.
20101231162818.000|20101231162821.000|TR0|
20101231162821.000|20101231162824.000|TR0|HARRIS:  Arizona's tough immigration law 
20101231162824.000|20101231162827.000|TR0|appears to be on a similar path to the 
20101231162827.000|20101231162830.000|TR0|U.S. Supreme Court.  How do you see that 
20101231162830.000|20101231162833.000|TR0|shaking out?
20101231162833.000|20101231162836.000|TR0|
20101231162836.000|20101231162839.000|TR0|FRIEDMAN:  Well, I see this as a 
20101231162839.000|20101231162842.000|TR0|constitutional no-brainer.  And let me 
20101231162842.000|20101231162845.000|TR0|explain why.
20101231162845.000|20101231162848.000|TR0|
20101231162848.000|20101231162851.000|TR0|Long before this law in Arizona took 
20101231162851.000|20101231162853.000|TR0|effect in the spring of 2010, Arizona 
20101231162853.000|20101231162856.000|TR0|legislators knew that the supremacy clause 
20101231162856.000|20101231162859.000|TR0|governs immigration.  That's very 
20101231162859.000|20101231162902.000|TR0|important, Tony, because that means that 
20101231162902.000|20101231162905.000|TR0|states and municipalities cannot impact on 
20101231162905.000|20101231162908.000|TR0|immigration.
20101231162908.000|20101231162911.000|TR0|
20101231162911.000|20101231162914.000|TR0|The supremacy clause places exclusive 
20101231162914.000|20101231162917.000|TR0|domain on immigration with the Congress.  
20101231162917.000|20101231162920.000|TR0|So, the day that law was supposed to take 
20101231162920.000|20101231162923.000|TR0|effect, a federal district judge granted 
20101231162923.000|20101231162926.000|TR0|an injunction against it, and the case is 
20101231162926.000|20101231162929.000|TR0|now before the U.S. Court of Appeals for 
20101231162929.000|20101231162932.000|TR0|the Ninth Circuit.  That sits in San 
20101231162932.000|20101231162935.000|TR0|Francisco.
20101231162935.000|20101231162938.000|TR0|
20101231162938.000|20101231162941.000|TR0|I think it will be a unanimous decision 
20101231162941.000|20101231162944.000|TR0|that HB-1020, the Arizona immigration law, 
20101231162944.000|20101231162947.000|TR0|is unconstitutional.   And while other 
20101231162947.000|20101231162950.000|TR0|states are following, all those laws are 
20101231162950.000|20101231162952.000|TR0|likely unconstitutional based on the 
20101231162952.000|20101231162955.000|TR0|supremacy clause.     HARRIS:  My friend,

20101231165603.000|20101231165606.000|TR0|
20101231165606.000|20101231165609.000|TR0|(BEGIN VIDEOTAPE)     ANURADHA KOIRALA, 
20101231165609.000|20101231165612.000|TR0|PROTECTING THE POWERLESS:  In the West, 
20101231165612.000|20101231165615.000|TR0|America, Europe, if someone comes and says 
20101231165615.000|20101231165618.000|TR0|I want to make your child a prostitute, 
20101231165618.000|20101231165621.000|TR0|you would give them one slap or shoot 
20101231165621.000|20101231165624.000|TR0|them.  But here, families, they are 
20101231165624.000|20101231165627.000|TR0|tricked all the time.
20101231165627.000|20101231165630.000|TR0|
20101231165630.000|20101231165633.000|TR0|Girls are brought from the villages by 
20101231165633.000|20101231165635.000|TR0|people who can lure them and tell them 
20101231165635.000|20101231165638.000|TR0|that they're getting a nice job.
20101231165638.000|20101231165641.000|TR0|
20101231165641.000|20101231165644.000|TR0|The border between India and Nepal is the 
20101231165644.000|20101231165647.000|TR0|conduit point of trafficking.  Once 
20101231165647.000|20101231165650.000|TR0|they're here, there is no way to escape.
